alert.note: Alert for Western Payette National Forest (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 06 at 6:59PM MDT until September 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS MUCH OF THE PAYETTE AND NORTHERN BOISE NATIONAL FORESTS...AS WELL AS ACROSS THE BURNS AND VALE BLM ZONES... ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY MAY CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL IDAHO... .An upper level trough and associated dry cold front will approach the region Wednesday afternoon. The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will result in critical fire weather conditions across portions of southeast Oregon and the Idaho Forest zones. Additionally, isolated thunderstorms may produce gusty, erratic outflow winds and may increase fire spread. Gusty northwest winds will continue across south central Idaho on Thursday with low relative humidity, which may result in critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR WESTERN PAYETTE NATIONAL FOREST...BURNS BLM AND VALE BLM...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 401...636 AND 637... * WINDS..In zone 401, west to southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. In zones 636 and 637, west to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. Brief gusts to 50 mph in isolated thunderstorm outflows. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 19 percent in zone 401, 10 to 15 percent in zones 636 and 637.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
